required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Untreated FolliculaR Lymphoma Treated With OBinituzumAb in a Non-interventional Study (URBAN)
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-Interventional, Retrospective And Prospective, Multicenter, Single Arm Study Evaluating The Effectiveness And Safety Of Obinutuzumab In Patients With Previously Untreated Advanced Follicular Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effectiveness and safety of obinutuzumab in clinical routine in 1L FL measured by the % of relapse within 24 months from start of therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: This observational study has been planned to evaluate the effectiveness of obinutuzumab in combination with chemotherapy in previously untreated advanced FL patients, in the real world setting in Italy. The study will allow to collect real-life data in a significant number of Italian patients when compared to participants in pivotal studies of obinutuzumab and thus will allow to verify in routine practice (after physician hands-on) the effectiveness and safety management in 50 reference sites all over the country.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Treatment initiation with obinutuzumab until first documented progression of disease or death due to disease progression, whichever occurs first, within 24 months from start of treatment

From first documentation of CR or partial response (PR) (whichever occurs first) until disease progression, as evaluated by the physician according to routine clinical practice or death, up to approximately 65 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period or death from any cause, whichever occurs first (up to approximately 24 months)
From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period or death from any cause, whichever occurs first (up to approximately 36 months)
From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period (up to approximately 65 months)
From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period or death from any cause, whichever occurs first (up to approximately 65 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from first dose to Loss of Clinical Benefit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to loss of clinical benefit, up to approx. 65 months
From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period (up to approximately 65 months)
From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period (up to approximately 65 months)
From first dose of Obinutuzumab to first documented response as assessed in clinical routine (up to approximately 65 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Patients with Stable Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period (up to approximately 65 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: 18F-fluorodeoxyglucose Positron Emission Tomography Response at End of Induction and End of Maintenance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline until end of the participant's observation period (up to approximately 65 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AE) and Serious AE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to until end of the participant's observation period (up to approximately 65 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with AEs of Special Interest (AESIs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline until end of the participant's observation period (up to approximately 65 months)

intervention.description: Induction phase: 1000 milligram (mg) intravenously (IV) on Day 1, 8, 15 of Cycle 1 an Day 1 of Cycles 2-6 or 2-8. Maintenance phase: 1000 mg IV every 2 months for 2 years or until disease progression (whatever occurs earlier).

study_pop.textblock: The patient population taking part in the study will comprise patients aged ≥ 18 years in first treatment for advanced FL, in which Obinutuzumab are administered in combination with chemotherapy during the induction phase, followed by Obinutuzumab maintenance therapy. This indication and treatment scheme is that approved by the EMA as per EU countries agency and AIFA as per Italian local agency.

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers may request access to individual patient level data through the clinical study data request platform (www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com). Further details on Roche's criteria for eligible studies are available here (https://clinicalstudydatarequest.com/Study-Sponsors/Study-Sponsors-Roche.aspx). For further details on Roche's Global Policy on Sharing of Clinical Study Information and how to request access to related clinical study documents, see here (https://www.roche.com/research_and_development/who_we_are_how_we_work/clinical_trials/our_commitment_to_data_sharing.htm).
